text: the last time we talked I never got a
chance to tell you that but a friend of
mine his son has autism and I was
speaking to Lance two days ago about
magic how do you feel magic will help
kids with autism
I think magic is a universal language
that really helps everybody on many
different levels
it is a form of escapism it shows us
that anything is possible in the world
in which we live with laws that that
tell us every day that there is gravity
that there is a reality yet in our art
form we can escape all those things and
create the illusion that anything is
possible and my art has connected to
people in a way that is the most
gratifying to me as an artist because
you know when somebody comes to me and
says you know I seen your demonstration
of you know body suspension or I seen
you be in a confined area and because of
those things now I'm able to confront my
own fears whether it's getting on an
airplane on an elevator or hey you know
what I always wanted to be a doctor or
lawyer it's never too late now I realize
that it's the most gratifying thing to
me when art affects people on an
emotional level and I think that magic
can affect and and and it's been proven
to to benefit people that of all
different challenges you know with all
different challenges there are a lot of
illnesses out there 75% of them are
caused by stress and by what we allow to
come into our mind so what kind of
visions do you use to be successful
throughout your life and what you input
in your mind and what you toss out well
you're certainly a product of your
thoughts you're a product of your
environment without being disrespectful
but if you hang out with you start
to smell like it you hang out with
positive people people that have passion
for life passion for what they want out
of life you start it starts to rub off
and affect you in a positive way
I believe when the mind body and spirit
works together anything is truly
possible and I I think that for me I am
now finding myself in sometimes the most
stressful situations because I literally
now I'm sure
seven days a week both mine freakin
phenomenon I have the live show at the
Luxor for the next four thousand six
hundred performances beginning summer of
O eight and I have more things going on
in my life with the released amount of
time I sleep on an average of two to
five hours a night and stress is
unbelievable what I really try to do is
I try to put everything in perspective
we are on this earth we don't know how
long it's up to us to live life each
moment to its fullest and the memories
that we create that we're responsible
for are what we're going to be
remembered by so with all that in
perspective with people and children's
that I see from the make-a-wish
Foundation who literally have just weeks
to live yet they have a beautiful smile
they have a passion for life and they
enjoy every single moment there on this
earth that reminds me of how much I have
to be grateful for and you know what all
the stress all the different problems I
might have on my business really is
meaningless because if I'm gone all of
that would be meaningless so you got to
appreciate and value the time you have
here and the most important thing I find
in the balance I get from my life what
little balance I have is by trying to do
positive things for other people there's
three things you can't buy in life
health love and happiness and a lot of
those things those to happiness and love
you can get that priceless gift when you
do something positive for somebody who
needs it the reward is much more
beneficial to you than it is
